posts.cooked: The Neo Vortex using Spark Max adapter makes a high pitch noise when we use it and becomes less effective. When we use it with a new SparkMax first time it works but then it starts making a high pitch noise and even though it still has the same RPM it has less power. It is plugged into the PDH with 40AMP breaker.
is anything showing up in rev hardware client with the sparkmax?
There are no faults, nothing seems unusual
have you narrowed down which component it is?

We tested the vortex on another bot and separately using REV hardware client and the only two possibilities are the vortex and sparkmax. As I said, it works fine with new spark max at first but then starts making high pitch noises and becoming less effective.
you’ll probably wnt to contact rev about the vortex then (assuming theres nothing visually wrong with the motor)

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Are you only testing in the REV client or is the code config being applied over and over with a reboot as a mismatch?

Now that you can configure the sparkMax in code and with the Vortex it’s easy to think you need the SparkFlex class instead of the SparkMax class to control it. When you plug in via USB-c to the spark max directly it knows it’s not a SparkFlex and doesn’t allow the misconfiguration.

We made this exact mistake copying code from a REV example and not double checking closely. The code will compile and run, you may not get a runtime warning (I can’t remember seeing one specifically), but you will definitely experience odd behaviors when trying to use that motor.
We tested it with rev client and with code, we checked and our code is for the sparkmax and not the sparkflex.
